    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public void eval(INDArray realOutcomes,
        INDArray guesses)
        Collects statistics on the real outcomes vs the guesses. This is for logistic outcome matrices. Note that an IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the two passed in matrices aren't the same length.
        Parameters:
        realOutcomes - the real outcomes (labels - usually binary)
        guesses - the guesses/prediction (usually a probability vector)

      • evalTimeSeries

        public void evalTimeSeries(INDArray labels,
                  INDArray predicted)
        Convenience method for evaluation of time series. Reshapes time series (3d) to 2d, then calls eval
        See Also:
        eval(INDArray, INDArray)

      • evalTimeSeries

        public void evalTimeSeries(INDArray labels,
                  INDArray predicted,
                  INDArray outputMask)
        Evaluate a time series, whether the output is masked usind a masking array. That is, the mask array specified whether the output at a given time step is actually present, or whether it is just padding.
        For example, for N examples, nOut output size, and T time series length: labels and predicted will have shape [N,nOut,T], and outputMask will have shape [N,T].
        See Also:
        evalTimeSeries(INDArray, INDArray)

        public java.lang.String stats()
        Method to obtain the classification report, as a String
        Returns:
        A (multi-line) String with accuracy, precision, recall, f1 score etc

      • precision

        public double precision()
        Precision based on guesses so far Takes into account all known classes and outputs average precision across all of them

        the total precision based on guesses so far

      • f1

        Calculate f1 score for a given class
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the f1 score for the given label

      • f1

        public double f1()
        TP: true positive FP: False Positive FN: False Negative F1 score: 2 * TP / (2TP + FP + FN)
        Returns:
        the f1 score or harmonic mean based on current guesses

      • accuracy

        public double accuracy()
        Accuracy: (TP + TN) / (P + N)
        Returns:
        the accuracy of the guesses so far
